title: Why isn’t my website for a Nasha Mukti Kendra in Punjab showing up properly in Firefox?
content:
There could be a few reasons why your website isn’t displaying correctly in Firefox. Sometimes it's due to outdated browser versions, cached data, or missing SSL certificates. Make sure your site is mobile-friendly, uses HTTPS, and passes basic performance checks on tools like PageSpeed Insights or GTmetrix.

I had a similar issue with a website for a Nasha Mukti Kendra in Punjab — it looked fine in Chrome but had layout issues in Firefox. Clearing the cache and fixing some CSS compatibility problems solved it. You might also want to check for any browser-specific code or unsupported scripts.
creator: rehabilitationcentrepunjab

title: About 1 in 10 pages will not load.
content:
I'm experience trouble with firefox loading pages. It seems that some pages (about 1 in 10) will not load first try. Instead it results in either a "unable to connect", "Hmmm... Can't reach this page" or simply a blank page. I have not noticed any pattern in the pages on which this occurs and they all display correctly after a refresh. This problem only occurs on firefox. I have already tried disabling the proxy without any success. I'm looking for any suggestions for solving/diagnosing this issue.

System info: Firefox 142.0.1 Fedora 42 Linux kernel 6.16.3-200.fc42.x86_64

title: Firefox profiles on Android
content:
I have 3 different profiles on my Desktop Firefox, and I'm able to change between them and even set some commands on CLI to switch between them easily, opening one or another.

Now, my question is: How can I do such a thing on mobile? I only linked my main account, and as far as I understood, I cannot link to multiple and switch on demand. Is there any way? Am I missing something?

I checked the tutorial on how to setup profiles and the profile manager doesn't seem to exist on mobile.

Thank you for your attention!

title: Lost All Firefox Data After Laptop Reboot
content: Hi, I’ve lost all of my saved passwords, bookmarks, and browsing history in Firefox. I’ve been a Firefox user for over five years, always tied to the same Firefox account email. My laptop recently had to be repaired, and the technicians performed a full reboot. After getting it back and reinstalling Firefox, all my data was gone. I tried recovering an old profile, but the reboot erased everything, so there are no old profiles or local data left on the device. Since my Firefox account has always been connected to the same email, I was hoping all of my data would still be recoverable, but I haven’t had any success. This represents over five years of saved information, and I really need help to restore it. Can Firefox support assist me in recovering my data through my account? Thanks in advance.
creator: zaradarini
